sn38.3:4.1: “Reverend Sāriputta, who in the world have principled speech? Who in the world practice well? Who are the Holy Ones in the world?”
sn38.3:4.2: “Reverend, those who teach principles for giving up greed, hate, and delusion have principled speech in the world.
sn38.3:4.3: Those who practice for giving up greed, hate, and delusion are practicing well in the world.
sn38.3:4.4: Those who’ve given up greed, hate, and delusion—so they’re cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, exterminated, and unable to arise in the future—are Holy Ones in the world.”
sn38.3:5.1: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for giving up this greed, hate, and delusion?”
sn38.3:5.4: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn38.3:5.5: right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samādhi.
sn38.3:5.7: This is the path, this the practice, for giving up this greed, hate, and delusion.”
sn38.3:5.8: “This is a fine path, a fine practice, for giving up greed, hate, and delusion.
sn38.3:5.9: Just this much is enough to be diligent.”
